sourceDesc.p: Wellington City Libraries book of typed transcriptions. Spine title "Hadfield, Typescript (amended) letters 1833-1854". Corrected by Gillian Ryan 1960. (page 29)
Re-typed and encoded into TEI by Melissa Bryant, 23.11.15

body.p: I am in a great hurry. I have just got a notice that I must be on board in two hours. I shall sleep on board as the ship goes out of dock before day light in the morning. If we have a fair wind we shall be out of the channel now in a few days. I have nothing to say. I am quite well and have put everything on board. I had wished to have written more fully to you but I cannot. May the Lord be with you all. Give my love to my father and mother and all and believe me
I write a few lines to George - farewell.
